dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 5694 IH: Afghan Allies Protection Amendments Act of 2018
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Kinzinger (for himself, Mr. Blumenauer, Mr. Moulton, and Mr. Stivers) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Afghan Allies Protection Act of 2009.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Afghan Allies Protection Amendments Act of 2018.

section.header: Special immigrant visas for Afghan allies

subsection.text: Section 602(b)(2)(A)(ii) of the Afghan Allies Protection Act of 2009 (8 U.S.C. 1101 note) is amended, in the matter preceding subclause (I), by inserting for the first time after submitting a petition.
Section 602(b)(3) of the Afghan Allies Protection Act of 2009 (8 U.S.C. 1101 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subparagraph (A) and inserting the following:

clause.text: In addition to any unused balance under subparagraph (F), for fiscal year 2019, not more than 4,000 principal aliens may be granted special immigrant status under this subsection.
For purposes of this subparagraph, the period of employment referred to in paragraph (2)(A)(ii) shall end not later than December 31, 2021.
For purposes of this subparagraph, not later than December 31, 2021, a principal alien seeking special immigrant status under this subsection shall submit an application to the Chief of Mission.

paragraph.text: by striking subparagraph (C) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: If the numerical limitation described in subparagraph (A)(i) is not reached for fiscal year 2019, the numerical limitation for each subsequent fiscal year shall be established at a number equal to the difference between—

clause.text: the numerical limitation described in subparagraph (A)(i); and
the number of principal aliens granted special immigrant status under this subsection during each fiscal year beginning in fiscal year 2019.

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (D), by striking notwithstanding the provisions of paragraph (C),; and

subparagraph.text: in clause (i), by striking 2020 and inserting 2020;;
in clause (ii), by striking 2020 and inserting 2020;;
by redesignating clauses (i) through (iii) as subclauses (I) through (III), respectively, and indenting appropriately;
in the matter preceding subclause (I) (as so redesignated), in the second sentence, by striking For purposes and inserting the following:
in the matter preceding clause (ii) (as so designated)—

clause.text: by striking exhausted,, and inserting exhausted,; and
by striking In addition and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: Any unused balance under this subparagraph shall be added to the number under subparagraph (A)(i) for use in fiscal year 2019.

subsection.text: Section 2 of Public Law 110–242 (8 U.S.C. 1101 note) is amended by striking subsection (b) and inserting the following:

The authority under subsection (a) shall expire on the date on which the numerical limitation specified under section 1244 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2008 (Public Law 110–181; 8 U.S.C. 1157 note) is reached.
Section 602 of the Afghan Allies Protection Act of 2009 (8 U.S.C. 1101 note) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (11) through (16) as paragraphs (10) through (15), respectively;
in paragraph (11)(A) (as so redesignated), by striking the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2014 and inserting this Act;
in paragraph (12) (as so redesignated), by striking paragraph (12)(B) and inserting paragraph (11)(B); and

in paragraph (13) (as so redesignated), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking a report to the and all that follows through House of Representatives and inserting a report to the appropriate committees of Congress;
